Summary: My thesis looked at disruptions as a means of exploring habits and behavior change.

Impact Skyline was the recipient of the Social Entrepreneurship Grant from the Center for Art and Public Life. The service design project redesigned the school experience at Skyline High School in Oakland, CA.
Company: Center for Art and Public Life

Summary: Aqui Estoy de Movistar is a family finder application for the large Spanish mobile carrier Telefonica.
IMG 360 was a physical training app for IMG Academies' elite youth and adult athletes.
Face-to-face conversations benefit from a number of non-verbal modes of communication. Lub Dub adds depth to communication by recreating a partner's heartbeat.
The Other End was a game created in collaboration with Jason Linder turning the CCA Grad Design studio space into a racing lane.
66edorp is an experimental laptop interface and part of a set of rethinkings of the laptop arrangement.
Elevator attempt to see if changing a device's screen interface could change its ergonomics and evolve a "new" device.
A prototype for a data-infused mirror.
Sprint Family Locator was an early geofencing applcation for parents to verify their children made it to school and practice on time with on-demand and scheduled GPS checks.
A thing that receives postings from the web and shouts them at passersby.
A parallax web prototype showcasing Alcon's latest contact lens technology.
Post Postal auto prints messages and tweets to a physical mailbox.
Vannevar tries to maintain a linear reading experience by pulling the first paragraph of linked Wikipedia articles in line with the current article.
Topo explores hypertext, text-as-image, and depth by generating topographic maps for Wikipedia articles.
A blockchain... out of which a global payments app, Valora, was created. Research pilots in Philippines, Mexico, and Kenya.
Valora is a safe place to store and send money. The app works globally (for anyone with a phone number) and is used for UBI programs, mobile payments, and remittances.

The World Bank was interested in using blockchain’s on-chain tracking to reduce error. We built a working demo with their Technology Team that tracks and visualizes funds. It provides detailed views of individual entities as well as a broad view over activity and the current location of funds.
Acrobat's web debut served as Adobe Document Cloud's opportunity to re-align the information architecture of one of the world's most used apps.
Liquid Mode (originally codenamed PDF.Next) is an Acrobat feature employing AI and OCR tech to turn static PDFs into fluid content, allowing good reading experiences on any device.

Bolt was a writing app for publishing next generation documents. It was a parallel effort to the PDF.Next project, which was in the process of developing a new more dynamic PDF — interactive, responsive, and less based on a paper paradigm.
Feedie was an app that turned the act sharing food photos on social media into sharing real food.
Brief was a tiny startup tackling file management via machine learning.
Foundational research to understand and design for the situational frames of financial advisors<wbr>—<wbr>in the office, in the field, and on their devices.
A theme hack for the Nylas N1 email client that rearranges UI layout, tidies up visuals, and adds a few subtle animations. (2 whole stars on GitHub! )
A plugin offering a few ways to visually trim NYT articles and maybe improve reading efficiency
At Location Labs, I worked on TweetMover, an iPhone application that automatically (or by prompt) tweets a user's arrival at a new location. Read more.
